titleStmt.title: George Bunch and L. D. Sutton to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6595

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To the Excelence the Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentuckey your petitianer George Bunch and L. D. Sutton Wold Respectfull Represent to your Excalence that some at the March Turm of the Whitley Circuit Courte 1865 that the Courte Renderdd Judgement against George Bunch for $40,00 for gaiming and that said bunch was a pore man and had alarge famley and that he was at that time unable to pay the same and that to Keepe him out of Jail that L. D. Sutton Replevd the said Judgements and that the said sutton is a pore mand ^&^ has alarge famley and not a man that evr is guilty of gaiming and that unless your Excelence enterpose they will have the Judgements to pay
The primis conciderd the prayers of your Petitioners is that your Excelence remit the fine and set asid the Judgement and Replevin Bond and for all Proper Releaf
sworn to be fore me by George Bunch and L D Sutton this 14th day of June 1865
The under signed says that they beleave it wold be an act of Charity to Remit the fine and set a sid the Judgement & Replevin Bond
